001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.util.Objects;
006
007import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheInterfaces;
008import io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput;
009import io.jstach.jstachio.Template.EncodedTemplate;
010
011/**
012 * A template and model combined with convenience methods.
013 * <p>
014 * This tuple like object is useful way to combine the correct template with a model if
015 * you have programmatic access to the template. This can be useful to a web framework
016 * perhaps as the return type of a web controller and because the template is already
017 * located the web framework does not have to re-find the template. An analog in the
018 * Spring framework would be <code>ModelAndView</code>.
019 * <p>
020 * It is purposely not parameterized for ease of use as dealing with generics via
021 * reflection can be difficult.
022 *
023 * @apiNote the interface is purposely sealed for now to see usage and feedback and one
024 * can make their own similar version with {@link JStacheInterfaces}.
025 * @author agentgt
026 *
027 */
028public sealed interface TemplateModel {
029
030        /**
031         * Template.
032         * @return template to use for execution
033         */
034        Template<?> template();
035
036        /**
037         * Model.
038         * @return model to be executed on
039         */
040        Object model();
041
042        /**
043         * Renders the passed in model directly to an appendable like output.
044         * @param <A> output type
045         * @param <E> error type
046         * @param output to write to.
047         * @return the passed in output
048         * @throws E if an error occurs while writing to output
049         */
050        public <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output<E>, E extends Exception> A execute(A output) throws E;
051
052        /**
053         * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream possibly leveraging
054         * pre-encoded parts of the template.
055         * @param <A> output type
056         * @param <E> error type
057         * @param output to write to.
058         * @return the passed in output
059         * @throws E if an error occurs while writing to output
060         */
061        default <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput<E>, E extends Exception> A write(A output) throws E {
062                return execute(output);
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Convenience method to write directly to an outputstream with the templates
067         * character encoding.
068         * @param outputStream outputStream to write to
069         * @throws IOException if an error happens while writting to the stream.
070         */
071        default void write(OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
072                write(Output.of(outputStream, template().templateCharset()));
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Renders the template to a String.
077         * @return the executed template as a string.
078         */
079        default String execute() {
080                return execute(Output.of(new StringBuilder())).getBuffer().toString();
081        }
082
083        /**
084         * Creates a template model pair.
085         * @param <T> model type
086         * @param template encoded template
087         * @param model model instance
088         * @return the template executable designed for encoded templates.
089         */
090        public static <T> TemplateModel of(EncodedTemplate<T> template, T model) {
091                return new EncodedTemplateExecutable<>(template, model);
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Creates a template model pair.
096         * @param <T> model type
097         * @param template encoded template
098         * @param model model instance
099         * @return the template executable.
100         */
101        public static <T> TemplateModel of(Template<T> template, T model) {
102                if (template instanceof EncodedTemplate<T> et) {
103                        return of(et, model);
104                }
105                return new DefaultTemplateExecutable<>(template, model);
106        }
107
108}
109
110record DefaultTemplateExecutable<T> (Template<T> delegateTemplate, T _model) implements TemplateModel {
111
112        static final String ERROR_MESSAGE = "The model passed into this TemplateModel is not correct";
113
114        @Override
115        public <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output<E>, E extends Exception> A execute(A output) throws E {
116                return delegateTemplate.execute(this._model, output);
117        }
118
119        @Override
120        public Template<?> template() {
121                return delegateTemplate;
122        }
123
124        @Override
125        public Object model() {
126                return Objects.requireNonNull(_model);
127        }
128
129}
130
131record EncodedTemplateExecutable<T> (EncodedTemplate<T> delegateTemplate, T _model) implements TemplateModel {
132
133        @Override
134        public <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output<E>, E extends Exception> A execute(A output) throws E {
135                return delegateTemplate.execute(this._model, output);
136        }
137
138        @Override
139        public <A extends EncodedOutput<E>, E extends Exception> A write(A output) throws E {
140                return delegateTemplate.write(_model, output);
141        }
142
143        @Override
144        public Template<?> template() {
145                return delegateTemplate;
146        }
147
148        @Override
149        public Object model() {
150                return Objects.requireNonNull(_model);
151        }
152
153}
